intro: Mascagnia anisopetala f. oblonga, commonly known as the narrow-leaf mascagnia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Apocynaceae family, characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, and it produces distinctive, milky sap. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local pollinators.
